titles: The undaunted seaman; who resolved to fight for his King and country: together with his love's sorrowful lamentation at their departure. To the tune of, I often for my Jenny strove. Licensed according to order.
publisher: Printed for P[hilip]. Brooksby, J[onah]. Deacon, J[osiah]. Blare and J[ohn]. Back.,
notes: Verse: "My love I come to take my leave ..."
Date, place of publication and publishers' names from Wing.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library.
